clinical_study.brief_title: One Step Versus Two Step Approach for Gestational Diabetes Mellitus Screening
clinical_study.official_title: One vs Two Step Approach for GDM Screening

brief_summary.textblock: Our study will assess if there is a difference in incidence of gestational diabetes using different screening approaches, either using a one-step approach with a 2 hour glucose tolerance test or using a two-step approach. Prior studies have proven similar incidences including a randomized controlled trial.

detailed_description.textblock:
Gestational Diabetes is screened for in pregnancy by drinking a solution containing a certain amount of glucose and testing blood glucose level one hour after drinking it. If this value is above a certain cut-off (>135mg/dl), the patient is subjected to another test involving drinking a solution containing a higher amount of glucose and checking blood glucose while fasting, 1 hour after drinking the solution and 2 hours after drinking the solution. (Two step approach).
Cut off values will be: 3 hour>180 mg/dl, 2 hour > 155 mg/dl, 1hour >140 mg/dl, fasting >95mg/dl. Two abnormal values will meet the diagnosis of gestational diabetes.
In other parts of the United States, and most of the rest of the word, screening for gestational diabetes uses a one-step approach by drinking a solution containing 75g of glucose (As recommended by the American Diabetic Society, the Endocrine Society, WHO and the International Association of Diabetes and Pregnancy Study groups1-3). Blood glucose values are checked at fasting, one hour and two hours after solution drinking.
The diagnosis of gestational diabetes is based on one elevated values. (cut off: Fasting ≥92mg/dl, 1hour ≥180 mg/dl, 2 hours ≥153 mg/dl).
Our study will assess if there is a difference in incidence of gestational diabetes using these different screening approaches. Prior studies have proven similar incidences including a randomized controlled trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of gestational diabetes diagnosed on each screening test of each arm.
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of the screening
primary_outcome.description: Gestational diabetes will be made based on one abnormal value. Fasting ≥126 mg/dl; 1 hour≥ 180 mg/dl and 2 hour ≥ 153 mg/dl

secondary_outcome.description: incidence of cesarean delivery, spontaneous vaginal delivery, operative vaginal delivery, and induction of labor
incidence of shoulder dystocia, and birth trauma

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between birth and 28 days of age
secondary_outcome.description: includes necrotizing enterocolitis, respiratory distress syndrome, intraventricular hemorrhage, hypoglycemia, jaundice, hyperbilirubinemia, perinatal death, admission to neonatal intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Fetal growth restriction, large for gestational age and polyhydramnios
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of Fetal growth restriction,large for gestational age and polyhydramnios
Mean of birth weight and incidence of macrosomia

arm_group.description: The intervention is gestational diabetes screening with 2 hour GTT 75 g load.
There is no intervention is this arm as patients will subjected to routine gestational diabetes screening with one hour glucola, 50 g load.

intervention.intervention_name: GDM screening with 75 g 2 hour GTT
intervention.description: Patients will be diagnosed with gestational diabetes if they have one abnormal value: Fasting ≥ 92; 2 hour ≥ 180 mg/dl;1 hour ≥ 153 mg/dl.

intervention.intervention_name: GDM screening with two step approach
intervention.description: 1 hour glucola with 50 g glucose load followed by 100 g glucose load if 1 hour glucola positive

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 16-50 year of age
- Pregnant women (limits the participants to female gender)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregestational Diabetes Mellitus
- History of bariatric surgery

eligibility.gender_description: Pregnant women (limits the participants to female gender)
